content.title: Preoperative Vein Mapping
content.definition: Duplex ultrasound to assess GSV, SSV, arm veins. Minimum diameter 3mm. Note varicosities, previous harvest.
content.statement: Preoperative Vein Mapping is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Preoperative Vein Mapping helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Preoperative Vein Mapping include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Preoperative Vein Mapping.

clinical_pearls: Key point about Preoperative Vein Mapping

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Preoperative Vein Mapping. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
